title: Should increase amount of perma bans by about x10.
body: Seriously. Can't even get through champ select these days without toxicity. You literally grief yourself playing this game. Unbelievable. If a lot of these kids actually got perma banned you would see results. And in the end you'd make more money because their parents are going to buy them all the skins and shit again on their new accounts.

replies.body:
I find that the toxicity I experience is decreased by doing the following things:

* Muting at the first sign of toxicity. I report them after the match and promptly forget about them.
* Playing with people I know.
* Taking a break when I notice myself going on tilt.

This. It really depends on how badly tilting affects you; I don't let it affect me and don't mute because the player may redeem themselves.

For example "I hate brand hes doing so bad" if you instant mute he could type "Oops I mean braum (when brand is you and braum is on other team)
You suggest more permabans... but you don't suggest **why** they need more, nor who the extra permabans should go to.

Why increase the amount of perma-bans?
Perma-bans don't let you show any form of reform.
Also, HOW.
Well that makes sense. After all, you are the tax collector...

Hmm ... what?

You post doesn't have a whole lot of context.

But how will this help people reform? Remember that when RIot bans people its because they no longer want them to play their game. Before all that you get different types of punishment. Sadly people dont take those seriously, and when they do get ban all they would need to do is make a new account. The point of any kind of punishment for this game is to reform. How will banning them right off the bat going to help solve this problem?
With that said your last sentence doesnt really help especially since i would assume most of these "kids" probably dont buy skins/RP, as majority of the people who do play this game dont spend a dime.
And people say China doesn't know what they are doing.
We need no perma bans for verbal toxicity
